displayName: Microsoft Sentinel Network Session ASim schema
description: The Microsoft Sentinel network session normalization schema represents an IP network activity.
icmTeam: Microsoft Azure Sentinel/Data Collection and Processing

tables.description: The Microsoft Sentinel network session normalization schema represents an IP network activity, such as network connections and network sessions. Such events are reported, for example, by operating systems, routers, firewalls, and intrusion prevention systems.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) reflecting the time in which the event was generated.

columns.name: EventCount
columns.description: This value is used when the source supports aggregation, and a single record may represent multiple events.

columns.name: EventSchemaVersion
columns.description: The version of the schema.

columns.name: DvcAction
columns.description: The action taken on the network session.

columns.name: EventMessage
columns.description: A general message or description.

columns.name: EventSeverity
columns.description: The severity of the event. Valid values are: Informational, Low, Medium, or High.

columns.name: EventStartTime
columns.description: The time in which the event started. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time that the first event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: EventEndTime
columns.description: The time in which the event ended. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time that the last event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: DvcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event. Example: 00:1B:44:11:3A:B7

columns.name: Dvc
columns.description: A unique identifier of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcZone
columns.description: The network on which the event occurred or which reported the event. The zone is defined by the reporting device.

columns.name: EventProductVersion
columns.description: The version of the product generating the event.

columns.name: DvcOriginalAction
columns.description: The original DvcAction as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: DvcInterface
columns.description: The network interface on which data was captured. This field is typically relevant to network related activity which is captured by an intermediate or tap device.

columns.name: DvcSubscriptionId
columns.description: The cloud platform subscription ID the device belongs to. DvcSubscriptionId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: EventOriginalSeverity
columns.description: The original severity as provided by the reporting device. This value is used to derive EventSeverity.

columns.name: EventOriginalSubType
columns.description: The original event subtype or ID, if provided by the source. For example, this field will be used to store the original Windows logon type. This value is used to derive EventSubType, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: NetworkApplicationProtocol
columns.description: The application layer protocol used by the connection or session.

columns.name: NetworkProtocolVersion
columns.description: The version of NetworkProtocol.

columns.name: NetworkDirection
columns.description: The direction of the connection or session.

columns.name: NetworkIcmpCode
columns.description: For an ICMP message, the ICMP message type numeric value as described in RFC 2780 for IPv4 network connections, or in RFC 4443 for IPv6 network connections.

columns.name: NetworkIcmpType
columns.description: For an ICMP message, the ICMP message type text representation, as described in RFC 2780 for IPv4 network connections, or in RFC 4443 for IPv6 network connections.

columns.name: NetworkConnectionHistory
columns.description: TCP flags and other potential IP header information.

columns.name: DstBytes
columns.description: The number of bytes sent from the destination to the source for the connection or session. If the event is aggregated, DstBytes is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: SrcBytes
columns.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination for the connection or session. If the event is aggregated, SrcBytes is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: NetworkBytes
columns.description: Number of bytes sent in both directions. If both BytesReceived and BytesSent exist, BytesTotal should equal their sum. If the event is aggregated, NetworkBytes is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: DstPackets
columns.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source for the connection or session. The meaning of a packet is defined by the reporting device. If the event is aggregated, DstPackets is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: SrcPackets
columns.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination for the connection or session. The meaning of a packet is defined by the reporting device. If the event is aggregated, SrcPackets is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: NetworkPackets
columns.description: The number of packets sent in both directions. If both PacketsReceived and PacketsSent exist, BytesTotal should equal their sum. The meaning of a packet is defined by the reporting device. If the event is aggregated, NetworkPackets is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: NetworkSessionId
columns.description: The session identifier as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstZone
columns.description: The network zone of the destination, as defined by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstInterfaceName
columns.description: The network interface used for the connection or session by the destination device.

columns.name: DstInterfaceGuid
columns.description: The GUID of the network interface used on the destination device.

columns.name: DstMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the network interface used for the connection or session by the destination device.

columns.name: DstVlanId
columns.description: The VLAN ID related to the destination device.

columns.name: DstSubscriptionId
columns.description: The cloud platform subscription ID the destination device belongs to. DstSubscriptionId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: DstGeoCountry
columns.description: The country associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstGeoRegion
columns.description: The region, or state, within a country associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstGeoCity
columns.description: The city associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstGeoLatitude
columns.description: The latitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstGeoLongitude
columns.description: The longitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstUserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the destination user.

columns.name: DstUserIdType
columns.description: The type of the ID stored in the DstUserId field.

columns.name: DstUsername
columns.description: The destination username, including domain information when available. Use the simple form only if domain information isn't available.

columns.name: DstUsernameType
columns.description: Specifies the type of the username stored in the DstUsername field.

columns.name: DstUserType
columns.description: The type of destination user.

columns.name: DstOriginalUserType
columns.description: The original destination user type, if provided by the source.

columns.name: DstAppName
columns.description: The name of the destination application.

columns.name: DstAppId
columns.description: The ID of the destination application, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstAppType
columns.description: The type of the destination application.

columns.name: SrcZone
columns.description: The network zone of the source, as defined by the reporting device.

columns.name: SrcInterfaceName
columns.description: The network interface used for the connection or session by the source device.

columns.name: SrcInterfaceGuid
columns.description: The GUID of the network interface used on the source device.

columns.name: SrcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the network interface from which the connection or session originated.

columns.name: SrcVlanId
columns.description: The VLAN ID related to the source device.

columns.name: SrcSubscriptionId
columns.description: The cloud platform subscription ID the source device belongs to. SrcSubscriptionId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: SrcGeoCountry
columns.description: The country associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoRegion
columns.description: The region within a country associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoCity
columns.description: The city associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLatitude
columns.description: The latitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLongitude
columns.description: The longitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcAppName
columns.description: The name of the source application.

columns.name: SrcAppId
columns.description: The ID of the source application, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: SrcAppType
columns.description: The type of the source application.

columns.name: DstNatIpAddr
columns.description: The DstNatIpAddr represents either of: The original address of the destination device if network address translation was used or the IP address used by the intermediary device for communication with the source.

columns.name: DstNatPortNumber
columns.description: If reported by an intermediary NAT device, the port used by the NAT device for communication with the source.

columns.name: SrcNatIpAddr
columns.description: The SrcNatIpAddr represents either of: The original address of the source device if network address translation was used or the IP address used by the intermediary device for communication with the destination.

columns.name: SrcNatPortNumber
columns.description: If reported by an intermediary NAT device, the port used by the NAT device for communication with the destination.

columns.name: DvcInboundInterface
columns.description: If reported by an intermediary device, the network interface used by the NAT device for the connection to the source device.

columns.name: DvcOutboundInterface
columns.description: If reported by an intermediary device, the network interface used by the NAT device for the connection to the destination device.

columns.name: NetworkRuleName
columns.description: The name or ID of the rule by which DvcAction was decided upon.

columns.name: NetworkRuleNumber
columns.description: The number of the rule by which DvcAction was decided upon.

columns.name: ThreatId
columns.description: The ID of the threat or malware identified in the network session.

columns.name: ThreatName
columns.description: The name of the threat or malware identified in the network session.

columns.name: ThreatCategory
columns.description: The category of the threat or malware identified in the network session.

columns.name: ThreatRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the session. The level is a number between 0 to 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: The operation reported by the record.

columns.name: EventSubType
columns.description: Additional description of the event type, if applicable.

columns.name: EventResult
columns.description: The outcome of the event, represented by one of the following values: Success, Partial, Failure, NA (Not Applicable). The value may not be provided directly by the sources, in which case it is derived from other event fields, for example, the EventResultDetails field.

columns.name: EventResultDetails
columns.description: Reason or details for the result reported in the EventResult field.

columns.name: EventOriginalType
columns.description: The original event type or ID, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventProduct
columns.description: The product generating the event.

columns.name: EventVendor
columns.description: The vendor of the product generating the event.

columns.name: DvcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP Address of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcHostname
columns.description: The hostname of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomainType
columns.description: The type of DvcDomain. Possible values include 'Windows' and 'FQDN'.

columns.name: DvcOs
columns.description: The operating system running on the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcOsVersion
columns.description: The version of the operating system on the device reporting the event.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information, represented using key/value pairs provided by the source which do not map to ASim.

columns.name: SrcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address from which the connection or session originated.

columns.name: SrcPortNumber
columns.description: The IP port from which the connection originated. Might not be relevant for a session comprising multiple connections.

columns.name: DstIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address of the connection or session destination.

columns.name: NetworkProtocol
columns.description: The IP protocol used by the connection or session as listed in IANA protocol assignment, which is typically TCP, UDP, or ICMP.

columns.name: EventOriginalUid
columns.description: A unique ID of the original record, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventReportUrl
columns.description: A URL provided in the event for a resource that provides more information about the event.

columns.name: DvcFQDN
columns.description: The hostname of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcId
columns.description: The unique ID of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcIdType
columns.description: The type of DvcId.

columns.name: SrcHostname
columns.description: The source device hostname, excluding domain information. If no device name is available, may store the relevant IP address.

columns.name: SrcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the source device.

columns.name: SrcDomainType
columns.description: The type of SrcDomain.

columns.name: SrcFQDN
columns.description: The source device hostname, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SrcDvcId
columns.description: The ID of the source device.

columns.name: SrcDvcIdType
columns.description: The type of SrcDvcId.

columns.name: ThreatIpAddr
columns.description: An IP address for which a threat was identified. The field ThreatField contains the name of the field ThreatIpAddr represents.

columns.name: SrcDeviceType
columns.description: The type of the source device.

columns.name: SrcUserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the source user.

columns.name: SrcUserIdType
columns.description: The type of the ID stored in the SrcUserId field.

columns.name: SrcUsername
columns.description: The source username, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SrcUsernameType
columns.description: Specifies the type of the username stored in the SrcUsername field.

columns.name: SrcUserType
columns.description: The type of the source user.

columns.name: SrcOriginalUserType
columns.description: The original destination user type, if provided by the by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstPortNumber
columns.description: The destination IP port.

columns.name: DstHostname
columns.description: The destination device hostname, excluding domain information.

columns.name: DstDomain
columns.description: The domain of the destination device.

columns.name: DstDomainType
columns.description: The type of DstDomain.

columns.name: DstFQDN
columns.description: The destination device hostname, including domain information when available.

columns.name: DstDvcId
columns.description: The ID of the destination device.

columns.name: DstDvcIdType
columns.description: The type of DstDvcId.

columns.name: DstDeviceType
columns.description: The type of the destination device.

columns.name: TcpFlagsAck
columns.description: The TCP ACK flag reported. The acknowledgment flag is used to acknowledge the successful receipt of a packet. As we can see from the diagram above, the receiver sends an ACK as well as a SYN in the second step of the three way handshake process to tell the sender that it received its initial packet.

columns.name: TcpFlagsFin
columns.description: The TCP FIN flag reported. The finished flag means there is no more data from the sender. Therefore, it is used in the last packet sent from the sender.

columns.name: TcpFlagsPsh
columns.description: The TCP PSH flag reported. The push flag is somewhat similar to the URG flag and tells the receiver to process these packets as they are received instead of buffering them.

columns.name: TcpFlagsRst
columns.description: The TCP RST flag reported. The reset flag gets sent from the receiver to the sender when a packet is sent to a particular host that was not expecting it.

columns.name: TcpFlagsUrg
columns.description: The TCP URG flag reported. The urgent flag is used to notify the receiver to process the urgent packets before processing all other packets. The receiver will be notified when all known urgent data has been received. See RFC 6093 for more details.

columns.name: TcpFlagsSyn
columns.description: The TCP SYN flag reported. The synchronisation flag is used as a first step in establishing a three way handshake between two hosts. Only the first packet from both the sender and receiver should have this flag set.

columns.name: ThreatField
columns.description: The field for which a threat was identified. The value is either SrcIpAddr, DstIpAddr, Domain, or DnsResponseName.
True ID the threat identified is considered an active threat.
The confidence level of the threat identified, normalized to a value between 0 and a 100.

columns.name: NetworkDuration
columns.description: The amount of time, in milliseconds, for the completion of the network session or connection.

columns.name: DvcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the device. For example: Primary Domain Controller.

columns.name: EventOriginalResultDetails
columns.description: The original result details provided by the source. This value is used to derive EventResultDetails, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: ThreatFirstReportedTime
columns.description: The first time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: ThreatLastReportedTime
columns.description: The last time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalConfidence
columns.description: The original confidence level of the threat identified, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the destination.

columns.name: SrcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the source.

tables.description: The Microsoft Sentinel network session normalization schema represents an IP network activity, such as network connections and network sessions. Such events are reported, for example, by operating systems, routers, firewalls, and intrusion prevention systems.

columns.name: TimeGenerated
columns.description: The timestamp (UTC) reflecting the time in which the event was generated.

columns.name: EventCount
columns.description: This value is used when the source supports aggregation, and a single record may represent multiple events.

columns.name: EventSchemaVersion
columns.description: The version of the schema.

columns.name: DvcAction
columns.description: The action taken on the network session.

columns.name: EventMessage
columns.description: A general message or description.

columns.name: EventSeverity
columns.description: The severity of the event. Valid values are: Informational, Low, Medium, or High.

columns.name: EventStartTime
columns.description: The time in which the event started. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time that the first event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: EventEndTime
columns.description: The time in which the event ended. If the source supports aggregation and the record represents multiple events, the time that the last event was generated. If not provided by the source record, this field aliases the TimeGenerated field.

columns.name: DvcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event. Example: 00:1B:44:11:3A:B7

columns.name: Dvc
columns.description: A unique identifier of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcZone
columns.description: The network on which the event occurred or which reported the event. The zone is defined by the reporting device.

columns.name: EventProductVersion
columns.description: The version of the product generating the event.

columns.name: DvcOriginalAction
columns.description: The original DvcAction as provided by the reporting device.

columns.name: DvcInterface
columns.description: The network interface on which data was captured. This field is typically relevant to network related activity which is captured by an intermediate or tap device.

columns.name: DvcSubscriptionId
columns.description: The cloud platform subscription ID the device belongs to. DvcSubscriptionId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: EventOriginalSeverity
columns.description: The original severity as provided by the reporting device. This value is used to derive EventSeverity.

columns.name: EventOriginalSubType
columns.description: The original event subtype or ID, if provided by the source. For example, this field will be used to store the original Windows logon type. This value is used to derive EventSubType, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: NetworkApplicationProtocol
columns.description: The application layer protocol used by the connection or session.

columns.name: NetworkProtocolVersion
columns.description: The version of NetworkProtocol.

columns.name: NetworkDirection
columns.description: The direction of the connection or session.

columns.name: NetworkIcmpCode
columns.description: For an ICMP message, the ICMP message type numeric value as described in RFC 2780 for IPv4 network connections, or in RFC 4443 for IPv6 network connections.

columns.name: NetworkIcmpType
columns.description: For an ICMP message, the ICMP message type text representation, as described in RFC 2780 for IPv4 network connections, or in RFC 4443 for IPv6 network connections.

columns.name: NetworkConnectionHistory
columns.description: TCP flags and other potential IP header information.

columns.name: DstBytes
columns.description: The number of bytes sent from the destination to the source for the connection or session. If the event is aggregated, DstBytes is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: SrcBytes
columns.description: The number of bytes sent from the source to the destination for the connection or session. If the event is aggregated, SrcBytes is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: NetworkBytes
columns.description: Number of bytes sent in both directions. If both BytesReceived and BytesSent exist, BytesTotal should equal their sum. If the event is aggregated, NetworkBytes is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: DstPackets
columns.description: The number of packets sent from the destination to the source for the connection or session. The meaning of a packet is defined by the reporting device. If the event is aggregated, DstPackets is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: SrcPackets
columns.description: The number of packets sent from the source to the destination for the connection or session. The meaning of a packet is defined by the reporting device. If the event is aggregated, SrcPackets is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: NetworkPackets
columns.description: The number of packets sent in both directions. If both PacketsReceived and PacketsSent exist, BytesTotal should equal their sum. The meaning of a packet is defined by the reporting device. If the event is aggregated, NetworkPackets is the sum over all aggregated sessions.

columns.name: NetworkSessionId
columns.description: The session identifier as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstZone
columns.description: The network zone of the destination, as defined by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstInterfaceName
columns.description: The network interface used for the connection or session by the destination device.

columns.name: DstInterfaceGuid
columns.description: The GUID of the network interface used on the destination device.

columns.name: DstMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the network interface used for the connection or session by the destination device.

columns.name: DstVlanId
columns.description: The VLAN ID related to the destination device.

columns.name: DstSubscriptionId
columns.description: The cloud platform subscription ID the destination device belongs to. DstSubscriptionId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: DstGeoCountry
columns.description: The country associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstGeoRegion
columns.description: The region, or state, within a country associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstGeoCity
columns.description: The city associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstGeoLatitude
columns.description: The latitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstGeoLongitude
columns.description: The longitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the destination IP address.

columns.name: DstUserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the destination user.

columns.name: DstUserIdType
columns.description: The type of the ID stored in the DstUserId field.

columns.name: DstUsername
columns.description: The destination username, including domain information when available. Use the simple form only if domain information isn't available.

columns.name: DstUsernameType
columns.description: Specifies the type of the username stored in the DstUsername field.

columns.name: DstUserType
columns.description: The type of destination user.

columns.name: DstOriginalUserType
columns.description: The original destination user type, if provided by the source.

columns.name: DstAppName
columns.description: The name of the destination application.

columns.name: DstAppId
columns.description: The ID of the destination application, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstAppType
columns.description: The type of the destination application.

columns.name: SrcZone
columns.description: The network zone of the source, as defined by the reporting device.

columns.name: SrcInterfaceName
columns.description: The network interface used for the connection or session by the source device.

columns.name: SrcInterfaceGuid
columns.description: The GUID of the network interface used on the source device.

columns.name: SrcMacAddr
columns.description: The MAC address of the network interface from which the connection or session originated.

columns.name: SrcVlanId
columns.description: The VLAN ID related to the source device.

columns.name: SrcSubscriptionId
columns.description: The cloud platform subscription ID the source device belongs to. SrcSubscriptionId map to a subscription ID on Azure and to an account ID on AWS.

columns.name: SrcGeoCountry
columns.description: The country associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoRegion
columns.description: The region within a country associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoCity
columns.description: The city associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLatitude
columns.description: The latitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcGeoLongitude
columns.description: The longitude of the geographical coordinate associated with the source IP address.

columns.name: SrcAppName
columns.description: The name of the source application.

columns.name: SrcAppId
columns.description: The ID of the source application, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: SrcAppType
columns.description: The type of the source application.

columns.name: DstNatIpAddr
columns.description: The DstNatIpAddr represents either of: The original address of the destination device if network address translation was used or the IP address used by the intermediary device for communication with the source.

columns.name: DstNatPortNumber
columns.description: If reported by an intermediary NAT device, the port used by the NAT device for communication with the source.

columns.name: SrcNatIpAddr
columns.description: The SrcNatIpAddr represents either of: The original address of the source device if network address translation was used or the IP address used by the intermediary device for communication with the destination.

columns.name: SrcNatPortNumber
columns.description: If reported by an intermediary NAT device, the port used by the NAT device for communication with the destination.

columns.name: DvcInboundInterface
columns.description: If reported by an intermediary device, the network interface used by the NAT device for the connection to the source device.

columns.name: DvcOutboundInterface
columns.description: If reported by an intermediary device, the network interface used by the NAT device for the connection to the destination device.

columns.name: NetworkRuleName
columns.description: The name or ID of the rule by which DvcAction was decided upon.

columns.name: NetworkRuleNumber
columns.description: The number of the rule by which DvcAction was decided upon.

columns.name: ThreatId
columns.description: The ID of the threat or malware identified in the network session.

columns.name: ThreatName
columns.description: The name of the threat or malware identified in the network session.

columns.name: ThreatCategory
columns.description: The category of the threat or malware identified in the network session.

columns.name: ThreatRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level associated with the session. The level is a number between 0 and 100.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalRiskLevel
columns.description: The risk level as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: EventType
columns.description: The operation reported by the record.

columns.name: EventSubType
columns.description: Additional description of the event type, if applicable.

columns.name: EventResult
columns.description: The outcome of the event, represented by one of the following values: Success, Partial, Failure, NA (Not Applicable). The value may not be provided directly by the sources, in which case it is derived from other event fields, for example, the EventResultDetails field.

columns.name: EventResultDetails
columns.description: Reason or details for the result reported in the EventResult field.

columns.name: EventOriginalType
columns.description: The original event type or ID, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventProduct
columns.description: The product generating the event.

columns.name: EventVendor
columns.description: The vendor of the product generating the event.

columns.name: DvcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP Address of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcHostname
columns.description: The hostname of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcDomainType
columns.description: The type of DvcDomain. Possible values include 'Windows' and 'FQDN'.

columns.name: DvcOs
columns.description: The operating system running on the device reporting the event.

columns.name: DvcOsVersion
columns.description: The version of the operating system on the device reporting the event.

columns.name: AdditionalFields
columns.description: Additional information, represented using key/value pairs provided by the source which do not map to ASim.

columns.name: SrcIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address from which the connection or session originated.

columns.name: SrcPortNumber
columns.description: The IP port from which the connection originated. Might not be relevant for a session comprising multiple connections.

columns.name: DstIpAddr
columns.description: The IP address of the connection or session destination.

columns.name: NetworkProtocol
columns.description: The IP protocol used by the connection or session as listed in IANA protocol assignment, which is typically TCP, UDP, or ICMP.

columns.name: EventOriginalUid
columns.description: A unique ID of the original record, if provided by the source.

columns.name: EventReportUrl
columns.description: A URL provided in the event for a resource that provides more information about the event.

columns.name: DvcFQDN
columns.description: The hostname of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcId
columns.description: The unique ID of the device on which the event occurred or which reported the event.

columns.name: DvcIdType
columns.description: The type of DvcId.

columns.name: SrcHostname
columns.description: The source device hostname, excluding domain information. If no device name is available, may store the relevant IP address.

columns.name: SrcDomain
columns.description: The domain of the source device.

columns.name: SrcDomainType
columns.description: The type of SrcDomain.

columns.name: SrcFQDN
columns.description: The source device hostname, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SrcDvcId
columns.description: The ID of the source device.

columns.name: SrcDvcIdType
columns.description: The type of SrcDvcId.

columns.name: ThreatIpAddr
columns.description: An IP address for which a threat was identified. The field ThreatField contains the name of the field ThreatIpAddr represents.

columns.name: SrcDeviceType
columns.description: The type of the source device.

columns.name: SrcUserId
columns.description: A machine-readable, alphanumeric, unique representation of the source user.

columns.name: SrcUserIdType
columns.description: The type of the ID stored in the SrcUserId field.

columns.name: SrcUsername
columns.description: The source username, including domain information when available.

columns.name: SrcUsernameType
columns.description: Specifies the type of the username stored in the SrcUsername field.

columns.name: SrcUserType
columns.description: The type of the source user.

columns.name: SrcOriginalUserType
columns.description: The original destination user type, if provided by the by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstPortNumber
columns.description: The destination IP port.

columns.name: DstHostname
columns.description: The destination device hostname, excluding domain information.

columns.name: DstDomain
columns.description: The domain of the destination device.

columns.name: DstDomainType
columns.description: The type of DstDomain.

columns.name: DstFQDN
columns.description: The destination device hostname, including domain information when available.

columns.name: DstDvcId
columns.description: The ID of the destination device.

columns.name: DstDvcIdType
columns.description: The type of DstDvcId.

columns.name: DstDeviceType
columns.description: The type of the destination device.

columns.name: TcpFlagsAck
columns.description: The TCP ACK flag reported. The acknowledgment flag is used to acknowledge the successful receipt of a packet. As we can see from the diagram above, the receiver sends an ACK as well as a SYN in the second step of the three way handshake process to tell the sender that it received its initial packet.

columns.name: TcpFlagsFin
columns.description: The TCP FIN flag reported. The finished flag means there is no more data from the sender. Therefore, it is used in the last packet sent from the sender.

columns.name: TcpFlagsPsh
columns.description: The TCP PSH flag reported. The push flag is somewhat similar to the URG flag and tells the receiver to process these packets as they are received instead of buffering them.

columns.name: TcpFlagsRst
columns.description: The TCP RST flag reported. The reset flag gets sent from the receiver to the sender when a packet is sent to a particular host that was not expecting it.

columns.name: TcpFlagsUrg
columns.description: The TCP URG flag reported. The urgent flag is used to notify the receiver to process the urgent packets before processing all other packets. The receiver will be notified when all known urgent data has been received. See RFC 6093 for more details.

columns.name: TcpFlagsSyn
columns.description: The TCP SYN flag reported. The synchronisation flag is used as a first step in establishing a three way handshake between two hosts. Only the first packet from both the sender and receiver should have this flag set.

columns.name: ThreatField
columns.description: The field for which a threat was identified. The value is either SrcIpAddr, DstIpAddr, Domain, or DnsResponseName.
True ID the threat identified is considered an active threat.
The confidence level of the threat identified, normalized to a value between 0 and a 100.

columns.name: NetworkDuration
columns.description: The amount of time, in milliseconds, for the completion of the network session or connection.

columns.name: DvcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the device. For example: Primary Domain Controller.

columns.name: EventOriginalResultDetails
columns.description: The original result details provided by the source. This value is used to derive EventResultDetails, which should have only one of the values documented for each schema.

columns.name: ThreatFirstReportedTime
columns.description: The first time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: ThreatLastReportedTime
columns.description: The last time the IP address or domain were identified as a threat.

columns.name: ThreatOriginalConfidence
columns.description: The original confidence level of the threat identified, as reported by the reporting device.

columns.name: DstDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the destination.

columns.name: SrcDescription
columns.description: A descriptive text associated with the source.
